events.originalText: Nimr al-Nimr, a prominent Shia cleric in Saudi Arabia, was executed by the Saudi government along with 46 other people.
events.subtitle: Nimr al-Nimr
events.headline: Saudi Arabia Executes Shia Cleric Nimr al-Nimr and 46 Others

events.originalText: Sri Lankan Civil War: The Sri Lankan army captured the town of Kilinochchi from the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam, concluding the Battle of Kilinochchi.
events.subtitle: Sri Lankan Civil War
events.headline: Sri Lankan Army Captures Kilinochchi from LTTE in Civil War

events.originalText: The Stardust space probe flew by the comet Wild 2 and collected particle samples from its coma, which were later returned to Earth.
events.subtitle: Stardust (spacecraft)
events.headline: Stardust Space Probe Collects Comet Samples from Wild 2

events.originalText: Sharon Pratt Dixon was sworn in as the mayor of Washington, D.C., becoming the first African-American woman to hold the position.
events.subtitle: Sharon Pratt
events.headline: Sharon Pratt Dixon Sworn in as First African-American Mayor of Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: An extratropical cyclone began affecting parts of western Europe, resulting in coastal flooding around the southern portions of the North Sea and leading to at least 82 deaths.
events.subtitle: Gale of January 1976
events.headline: Extratropical Cyclone Causes Coastal Flooding in Western Europe, 82 Deaths Reported

events.originalText: Ronald Reagan (pictured) began his career in government when he was sworn in as the 33rd governor of California.
events.subtitle: Ronald Reagan
events.headline: Ronald Reagan Sworn in as 33rd Governor of California

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The Viet Cong won its first major victory at the Battle of Ap Bac.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Viet Cong Wins First Major Victory at Battle of Ap Bac in Vietnam War

events.originalText: The Soviet Luna 1, the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon, was launched by a Vostok rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome.
events.subtitle: Luna 1
events.headline: Soviet Luna 1 Launched, First Spacecraft to Reach Moon's Vicinity

events.originalText: World War II: United States and Australian forces successfully landed in Papua New Guinea in an attempt to cut off a Japanese retreat.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US and Australian Forces Land in Papua New Guinea During World War II

events.originalText: Second World War: Llandaff Cathedral in Cardiff, Wales, was severely damaged by German bombing during the Cardiff Blitz.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Llandaff Cathedral in Cardiff Damaged by German Bombing in Second World War

events.originalText: Under the leadership of Attorney General A. Mitchell Palmer, U.S. Department of Justice agents launched a series of raids against radical leftists and anarchists in more than 30 cities and towns across 23 states.
events.subtitle: A. Mitchell Palmer
events.headline: Attorney General Palmer Leads Raids Against Leftists Across 23 States

events.originalText: Uruguayan War: Brazilian and Colorado Party forces captured the city of Paysandú from its Uruguayan defenders.
events.subtitle: Uruguayan War
events.headline: Brazilian and Colorado Party Forces Capture Paysandú in Uruguayan War

events.originalText: French mathematician Urbain Le Verrier (pictured) announced the putative discovery of the planet Vulcan at a meeting at the French Academy of Sciences in Paris.
events.subtitle: Urbain Le Verrier
events.headline: French Mathematician Urbain Le Verrier Announces Discovery of Planet Vulcan

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: American forces under the command of George Washington repulsed a British attack at the Battle of the Assunpink Creek near Trenton, New Jersey.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: American Forces Repulse British Attack at Battle of Assunpink Creek in Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Trunajaya rebellion: Amangkurat II of Mataram of Java and his courtiers stabbed Trunajaya to death a week after the rebel leader surrendered to VOC forces.
events.subtitle: Trunajaya rebellion
events.headline: Amangkurat II of Mataram Stabs Trunajaya to Death in Trunajaya Rebellion

events.originalText: Mercurius, a Roman priest, was elected Pope John II; he was apparently the first pope to adopt a new name upon elevation to the papacy.
events.subtitle: Pope John II
events.headline: Roman Priest Mercurius Elected Pope John II, First to Adopt New Name
